ARABIC: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: is there not in that an oath for the intelligent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Is there not an evidence in this for those who have sense?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Is there in this an oath for one endowed with understanding?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Is this not a sufficient oath for intelligent people?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Why is there an oath in this, for the intelligent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Is there (not) in them sufficient proofs for men of understanding!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Truly in that there is an oath for those who possess understanding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Is there in that an oath for a mindful man?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: There surely is an oath for thinking man.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: is there not in this strong evidence for a man of sense?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Indeed in that there is an oath for a man of sense.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Is there an oath in that for one possessing intellect?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Is there (not) in these an adjuration (or evidence) for those who understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: There is indeed in them (the above oaths) sufficient proofs for men of understanding (and that, they should avoid all kinds of sins and disbeliefs, etc.)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Is there in that an oath for the mindful?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Is there in this an oath for a rational person?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [89:5] Is there in that, oath, an oath for one of sense?, [one of] intellect (the response to the oath has been omitted, that is to say, [it is to be understood as something like], la-tu‘adhdhabunna yā kuffāra Makka, ‘you will assuredly be chastised O disbelievers of Mecca!’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (There) in that which I have mentioned (surely is an oath for thinking man.
